intro: Hemigenia viscida, commonly known as the sticky hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, giving it its common name. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Hemigenia viscida is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
